cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 mi (590 km) SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, forecast to turn northwest and approach the middle Texas coast, then stall near the coast through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi–Port O'Connor, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield TX to Mouth of the Rio Grande (T.S. Watch); South of Port Mansfield TX to Mouth of Rio Grande (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield TX to Matagorda TX (Hurricane Warning); North of Matagorda to High Island TX and south of Port Mansfield to Mouth of Rio Grande (T.S. Warning); Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass TX (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from the Rio Grande to High Island with highest threat between Port Mansfield and Matagorda
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: None – storm remains over 1,000 mi away from Toledo
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not listed (no Great Lakes sites included in probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-cyclone–related strong winds expected at Toledo-Lucas County Port, OH
